channel.title: Amazing World
channel.description: I am a first year undergraduate student, focusing on Theoretical Computer Science, Machine Learning and Quantum Computing.

item.title: A Introduction to Steiner Tree
item.description:
In the Steiner Tree problem, the input is a graph G(V,E), with a set of terminals S , and a cost c(e). The target is to find a minimum-cost tree which connects all terminals. The Steiner Tree problem is NP-Hard, and APX-Hard[1].

References: [1] M.Bern and P.Plassmann. The Steiner problems with edge length 1 and 2. Infomation Processing Letters 32, 171-176, 1989. link
